attributes.action: Free dental & optical treatment inc free glasses for diabetics.
attributes.background: Myself and other people who suffer from diabetes know the complications we suffer with our dental and eyesight problems, Causing very uncomfortable pain and strain. We are constantly paying huge bills to our dentists and opticians on a regular Basis for treatment we need, that we cannot prevent.
attributes.additional_details:
Diabetes is the leading cause of blindness in adults aged 20 to 74. High blood sugar which cannot always be prevented causes the lens of the eye to swell, which changes our ability to see.
Gum disease is much more common In a person who suffers from diabetes, this is because the red blood cells cannot fight infection as well as a non sufferer, causing pain and in time, brittle teeth. This in turn forces us to visit the dentist a lot more often than the average person.

attributes.action: Make car parking charges illegal in or around public parks
attributes.background: For as long as I remember, most public parks were for families, friends, dog walkers and couples etc to enjoy the sceneries, taking walks, picnics or generally just feeding the ducks and birds. But more and more public places are now charging people to park.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair now on people with little mobility, elderly and families that just wanted to spend a day out without having to pay. Places like Mote Park in Maidstone for example which has now started to charge parking fees. They justify this on the local government website by stating that this is to "keep it at the high standard residents and visitors have come to expect, as well as allowing for vital improvements". I am intrigued as to when they started to "keep it" at any standards.

attributes.action: Cycling revolution will cure the nation’s poor health.
attributes.background: 67% of men and 57% of women in the UK are overweight or obese. Coronary heart disease , stroke, type 2 diabetes, colon cancer , breast cancer, osteoarthritis , depression , dementia are just some of the diseases that can be prevented/delayed by doing regular exercise...
attributes.additional_details:
Imagine how much money could be saved by the NHS (£115 billion spent p.a.) if the population was healthier. This money should be spent on the following:
-More bike stands throughout the UK, a significant increase in Boris bikes and the introduction of Boris bikes in every city in the UK.
-A mass education program about the benefits of cycling in primary schools, secondary schools, universities and work places throughout the UK.
-Cycling facilities (e.g. lockers, secure bike sheds, showers) in the locations mentioned above.
-Longer cycle superhighways in London and superhighways in every city in the UK.

attributes.action: Make a ‘car mode’ setting a mandatory feature on all new smartphones.
attributes.background:
We believe that car mode will reduce the number of accidents on our roads.
Specifically, car mode would, when activated, and until such time it was turned off. Disable all phone calls, text messages and any form of application-based alerts that require the user to interact with the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
26% of all car accidents were caused by drivers using a mobile device (1 in 4). Connected Driver Survey 2015 - MORI Social Research Inst. 

Dialing a phone increases you chance of having an accident by 12 times while reading or writing a text increases your chances of having an accident tenfold.
According to a RAC Foundation survey, 60% of people "would be happy to use a 'vehicle safe mode' on external devices in cars."

attributes.action: Ban real animal fur from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Animals are being cruelly killed for their skin. These animals include; elephants, salt water crocs, snakes, foxes, wolves. 
The super rich including rappers, pop stars buy these skins in the form of coats, handbags and trainers. Some of these animals are skinned alive.
attributes.additional_details: Reggie yates documentary, Kim Kardashian

attributes.action: Hillsborough families compensated in full for 27 years of legal fees.
attributes.background: The Hillsborough victims families have for 27 years had to pay their own legal fees unearthing the truth of what happened on 15/04/89. The South Yorkshire Police and others held responsible for the tragedy that day have had their legal fees paid by the tax payer. Another miscarriage of justice.
attributes.additional_details: The families of the 96 people who died at Hillsborough have had to endure 27 years of pain and heartache uncovering what they always knew was the truth. The families themselves and campaign groups have had to find exorbitant amounts of money to fund a fight that should never have had to be fought whilst the establishment have continued to fund their cover up and lies fully funded by the tax payer.

attributes.action: Request postponement of  KS1 SPAG test viewable to ALL online since 28/01/16!
attributes.background: The Government accidentally placed on line the official SPAG test that your children will take in May! This has been available to view and use since Jan 28th 2016!  Some children in the country have already used this as a practice paper so will be sitting that self same test for real! Invalid test!!

attributes.action: Stop Charging children born in the UK £936 to register as British Citizens
attributes.background: Charging Children born in the UK £936 whilst their parents hadn't been granted settlement at the time of their birth  to register as a British Citizen is against their fundamental human rights.Some parents with three children pay about £2,808 which is not right.
attributes.additional_details: Home Office Master Fees Leaflet 2016-03-08( B(OTA), B(OS) EM MN1, S2 S3T) Child under 18 applying to register as a British citizen pay £936. **An additional £80 per applicant is required to cover the ceremony fee should the child turn 18 during the application process. This will be required at point of decision.

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into privately contracted benefit assessments by the DWP
attributes.background: Channel 4 Dispatches has revealed a systematic agenda to cut benefit payments by Capita, contracted for the DWP for Personal Independence Payment assessments alongside Atos. There is evidence to suggest systematic fraud and abuse of vulnerable adults by these companies. We call for a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.channel4.com/info/press/news/the-great-benefits-row-channel-4-dispatches

attributes.action: Review childcare provisions for older children with Special educational needs.
attributes.background: This is a call for the government to review child care provision for older children, aged 11-18 with special educational needs. Due to the lack of childcare provision for secondary school aged children many parents are forced to reduce their hours or leave work all together.
attributes.additional_details: A distinction needs to be made between personal care provision and child care. Personal one to one care is extremely expensive (11-20 per hours) when compared to the cost of child care (3.50 - 6 per hour). Personal care is also on a one to one basis where older children with special education would benefit more from the extra social interaction, after schools groups can provide. This lack of provision leads to an increased likelihood in benefit dependency and social exclusion.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of restitution with the Polish govt re WW2 confiscations
attributes.background: The Polish govt repeatedly refuses to pay compensation to all those whose property and chattels were confiscated during WW2

attributes.action: Stop schools forcing children to pray and sing religious songs in assembly.
attributes.background: It is not fair that children, in Primary Schools especially are forced to sing religious songs, hear biblical stories and say prayer in morning assemblies. Even if children are allowed to sit out (e.g. because they have different beliefs) that is encouraging isolation based on religion.

attributes.action: Introduce a temporary visa scheme for refugees
attributes.background: The introduction of a temporary visa scheme would allow safe temporary refuge to people escaping war and persecution. This would allow each case to be reviewed and when circumstances allowed, the refugees could be returned to their home country.  The visa would be granted for up to 3 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of our allies in the world use visa systems to control the influx of refugees and immigrants into their countries. It is made perfectly clear that the visa is temporary and this cannot be appealed. The UAE is an example. Visas there are only issued as temporary time limited visit or residency visas. 

In the case of refugees, once the situation is deemed to have improved in their country they return home to re-settle and rebuild their own country. No appeal to stay should be allowed.

attributes.action: Make it the law for all UK eateries to sell gluten free & lowfat dairy free food
attributes.background: Only a small amount of cafés in the UK offer gluten free & dairy free food. Some offer vegan and vegatarian food. It would be great if it was the law for all cafés and restaurants in the UK to provide food for all dietary issues then this would lessen suffering of uk long-term health improving life

attributes.action: Make companies legally obliged to allow staff time off work to donate blood
attributes.background: The government should legislate to make it a legal requirement for companies to give staff reasonable time off work to donate blood and other blood products, and staff should not lose salary, annual leave, other benefits or be required to make up lost time in doing so.
attributes.additional_details: Blood donations are vital to the NHS and save many lives every day. Yet getting time off work to donate blood can be very difficult. Employers are often reluctant to allow staff time out from their jobs for this purpose, meaning staff either have to use their annual leave entitlement, go unpaid, or make up the hours out of their own time. In a country which relies on blood donations every day this is a disgrace.

attributes.action: Remove reprimands from PNC records as soon as the offender turns into an adult.
attributes.background: Juveniles have previously been handed reprimands by Police as this was an easy and quick fix for them. However, this record stays until your 100th birthday and can have detrimental impact on your career, especially during vetting.
attributes.additional_details: I, myself have been in this predicament, when I applied to become a Police Constable and passed the rigorous recruitment process, only to be told that I failed my vetting due to a reprimand I received over 10 years ago and when I was a child, it was also disclosed on my application and I am sure other people have been penalised for this too!

attributes.action: Make the selling of electronic devices with pre-installed malware/adware illegal
attributes.background: A lot of low-end tablets and phones come with pre-installed malware and ad-ware that is a big security risk for the user, normally it is also not possible to remove these

attributes.action: Declare 8th May 'Attenborough Earth Day' to celebrate Sir David's 90th birthday
attributes.background: His love of the Natural World has inspired millions. This national day would celebrate his contribution and continue his aim to inspire the next generation to take care of our world by inviting us all to  do a little something to give back to the natural world

attributes.action: Set a time scale for disabled people to get an answer and payment off pip. .
attributes.background: Pip payments are the new dla and the system is appalling. Disabled people are getting increasingly sicker whilst waiting for a decision. asos who make assessments have no available staff to make appropriate appointments and people are suffering waiting for help
attributes.additional_details: According to figures 725000 have claimed pip and there is no time scale in place so the disabled are left waiting and often deteriorating in health. This doesn't seem to matter. Disabled need to buy equipment and aids to enhance their lives and are often left bedridden whilst waiting an appointment. Carers are working free as they cannot access funds until pip is issued.this has become a tremendous strain on the sick and the unpaid overworked carers. It's not acceptable to the British people

attributes.action: Recognise Israel's atrocities against Palestinians and take action to stop it.
attributes.background:
Israel continues to breach the human rights of Palestinians in its illegal occupation of the West Bank  and Gaza. 

I, as a UK citizen petition the UK Government to take action to isolate Israel in the international community until it changes its course and ends its apartheid against Palestinians.
attributes.additional_details:
The action should include:

1. Draft a fresh UN resolution. 
2. Impose full sanctions against Israel
3. Stop selling arms.
4. Proscribe the IDF as a weapon of terror. 
5. Require a plebiscite open to all residents (including refugees) to vote for either a 1 State solution where everyone has 100% equal rights or for a 2 State solution where both States are recognised and have all the comensurate rights and responsibilities of nationhood. 
6. Establish a legal process to compensate Palestinians.

attributes.action: Require all Members of Parliament to wear a uniform.
attributes.background: Given that some MPs are unable to behave with a maturity greater than that found in a year 8 classroom, they should be required, by law, to wear a uniform, whilst attending the House of Commons, to prevent bullying or harrassment on the basis of socioeconomic background and focus on their work.
attributes.additional_details:
In school, uniforms, prevent bullying, discrimination or otherwise mean behaviour by preventing children from being able to distinguish between each other on a socio-economic basis. Children of wealthy parents are unable to critique other children on the basis of the clothes they wear.

Since this behaviour is also found in the House of Commons it should be curbed by imposing a uniform, similar to ones found in schools across the country.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-35651049

attributes.action: To reduce the TV license fee due to BBC taking a channel off air to save money
attributes.background: BBC announced that BBC 3 will be taken offline due to restructuring, as a result this means everyone will be paying for a channel that is only available online. Now until superfast broadband is all over that leaves a large proportion of people unable to watch online tv and overpaying for a service
attributes.additional_details:
See the failed BT Superfast Roll Out 
See BBC 3 (as its officially gone off-air to an online platform) 
Look at the statistics many families who do not have access to internet still have to pay a TV License fee which goes to the BBC

If the TV License fee was reduced that would free up capital for citizens to spend on other commodities and so could free up much needed money for the vunerable individuals and allow people to spend in other areas of the Economy and give the UK greater independance

attributes.action: EU referendum vote only to be valid when turnout is 66% (2015 general election)
attributes.background: On Thursday 23rd June the United Kingdom will be voting to decide whether to stay in a 'reformed' European Union or leave. This is the biggest decision of a generation (far beyond a single government). It's only right that a required turn out be the same as the previous general election (2 thirds).
attributes.additional_details: The 'average person' currently does not necessary know the importance of staying or leaving and the effects it may have on them should we stay or leave. Therefore with such a major decision it's paramount that as a nation overall, votes are a fair sample. Not the majority of people who wanted to call the referendum in the first place to leave.

attributes.action: I want compulsory and periodic Performance testing for Politicians.
attributes.background: We live in a society where everyone is constantly been Performance tested, our schools, our Hospitals, our local counsels our Police Forces, Fire Services. Teachers, Doctors, Soldiers and many other fantastic People.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Politicians are making the most important decisions in our Country today and every day, but are not subjected to the same performance measures that other institutions are, this needs to change. 
The Position as a Politician should only be filled by the highest of caliber person and constantly be performance tested to ensure the very best for our Great Country.

attributes.action: re nationalise the energy companies
attributes.background: British Gas today announced an increase in profits to £574 million pounds a 31% increase, not for the first time that profits have increased. The regulator seems to be serving the energy companies and not the consumers who have to pay. I'm sure the dividend payed to shareholders will rise.
attributes.additional_details: Its about time consumers get a fair deal for the cost of energy. When we had Nationally owned energy companies it was the Government who decided on the cost. Wholesale gas prices have dropped by 40% and slowly the energy companies are reducing the cost but not fast and always after winter and never enough. Re Nationalise the energy companies or at the very least put in place a regulator who actually represents the consumers.

attributes.action: Exempt litigants-in-person from cost orders
attributes.background: With no legal aid, low income persons are forced to be litigants in person. Judges do not decide in favour of litigants-in-person almost as a rule. They use their discretion to favour the rich and represented party. Astronomical costs are then imposed on the poor litigant-in-person. This is unjust.

attributes.action: Prevent NHS basing eating disorder treatment on low BMI, by providing more funds
attributes.background:
Currently, when people approach GP's due to eating disorders, many are turned away due to not having a low enough BMI.
With increased NHS funding, people can be given access to the treatment they need before it's too late; radically reducing the number of lives lost due to these deadly illnesses.
attributes.additional_details:
B-eat, the leading eating disorder charity estimated that in 2015, 725,000 people in the UK were affected by eating disorders; with Anorexia nervosa having the highest mortality rate of all mental disorders. 

According to the NHS, 1 day, for 1 patient in hospital costs around £400. Therefore, money would be saved by giving people the access to treatment they need, before they reach the point of needing a hospital admission; which can last months.

attributes.action: Change law so a learner can ride a 250cc motorcycle once passed car test or CBT.
attributes.background:
Please change the law for learner motorcycle riders.
Please change from 125cc to 250cc for learner riders. 
Many accidents happen due to mopeds having small wheels.
It's pretty easy for the front wheel to slip away on a corner. Bikes with larger wheel don't usually have this problem.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also help the environment as 4stroke engines would be available. These are much cleaner with less pollutants entering the atmosphere.
If publicised right it could mean less cars on the already busy roads.

attributes.action: Introducing funding to help those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: There are many people in the UK that are experiencing mental health issues. This is a problem as people are still suffering from theses issues and not had the support needed. This has caused people to be in a worse situation than they would of if the had the support in the first place.
attributes.additional_details: This is important to me as i am experiencing this myself. I am wanting to change this  and stop making people waiting for professional help and get the qualified people in. By raising awareness we can make those vulnerable people and their friends and families feel they are not alone and make more peoples lives better. This can be done with more advertisement, more qualified professionals to set up more social action projects and one to one appointments.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Make fast food, take aways & restaurants clearly lable items containing alcohol
attributes.background:
All take away, Fast food and restaurants in the UK should have clear labels warning consumers about hidden alcohol in food.
People who don't consume alcohol for religious reasons and parents are unaware alcohol is being consumed when they eat certain products from food outlets.
attributes.additional_details: When I ate in wasabi today I asked if the sushi contained alcohol, I was told the sushi and curries contain alcohol and it's up to the consumer to ask the ingredients they shouldn't have to make people aware of the alcohol in the food. Mortified my child had just eaten the food, I was told it was my fault for not checking before hand. It's time to label food containing alcohol clearly.

attributes.action: Do not open a UK trade hub in any state that discriminates against LGBT+ people
attributes.background: The Department for International Trade, led by Dr Liam Fox who has the worst LGBT+ voting record of any cabinet member, intends to open a UK trade hub in Raleigh, North Carolina. This is despite the fact that the state's HB2 permits businesses to directly discriminate against the LGBT+ community.
attributes.additional_details:
HMG should join Paypal, HP, Deutsche Bank and others in refusing to support North Carolina until HB2 is repealed.

The DfIT has a duty not to send its LGBT+ staff, contractors and their families to states which treat them as second class citizens in a climate of fear and prejudice.

HMG has a duty to the global LGBT+ community to send a clear signal, even to our allies, that this discrimination is totally unacceptable. HMG must stand up for those struggling against injustice everywhere.

attributes.action: Allow all alternative milks on the school milk scheme for allergy sufferers
attributes.background: Currently the milk scheme in schools allows cows milk, lactose free milk, goats milk and sheep milk which are not suitable for children who have a dairy allergy. I feel that a child shouldn't be excluded from having milk, this is preventing them from much needed nutrients and are being singled out
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see the scheme offer alternative milks which are suitable for children with allergies such as almond, oat or coconut. Another alternative would be soya, however, this isn't suitable for all children with a dairy allergy.  This would then allow all children to have the milk they should be entitled to. Milk is very important for any child and they shouldn't have the opportunity taken away from them just because they have a dairy allergy.

attributes.action: Exteremly poor service, revoke Govia Ltd's franchise of Great Northern Railways
attributes.background: GNR are continuously running a bad service. They have ongoing late running trains and often cancel services due to lack of staff and broken trains. They have not invested in new rolling stock and the trains are constantly dirty, seats are broken and trains break down.

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: Free school transport for primary schools and high schools
attributes.background: Costs of travelling to school everyday add ups and parents struggle to pay for it. Also, the safety of the children is at risk of getting kidnapped or killed due to having to walk miles to school alone and/or on busy roads.

attributes.action: If UK weather reaches 30degrees people should get sent home from work on pay.
attributes.background:
Comfortable working environment.
To hot to work indoors. I.e factory's etc or any buildingwith broken aircon or without any Aircon.
attributes.additional_details:
UK workers.
Factory's,call centers etc or any other place with no aircon facilities.

attributes.action: I want the government to recognise  severe neuropathy as a disability
attributes.background: Neuropathy is a extremely painful progressive disease. Nothing can cure it,there is only treatment for the pain.It usually starts in the feet,then hands but eventually affects the whole body

attributes.action: Allow Spouses of Work Permit Holders to apply for ILR based on Domestic Violence
attributes.background: In June 2016,I finally sought help about the Domestic Violence against me. It was just 1 month before my husband would have obtained his Indefinite Leave to Remain(ILR). He now has a criminal record and may not get ILR. I am not eligible to apply for DV ILR because he is neither British nor Settled
attributes.additional_details: Under UK Immigration Law, only partners of British nationals/settled persons facing domestic violence (DV) can apply for settlement.This law forces people with abusive immigrant partners to stay on in the marriage.I have worked in the UK as a legal adviser for 5+ years but endured intense DV.I spoke out a month before my immigrant spouse would have acquired settlement.Now, I cannot apply for settlement for myself/2 kids born in the UK, just because I did not endure violence for yet another month

attributes.action: Fully-fund all disabled veteran British service people and their families.
attributes.background: For too long, the RBL Poppy Appeal and HFH charities subsidies care and support given to disabled returned service people and their families. Taxation is being squandered on Trident when the real cost has already been incurred. It is morally wrong to depend on charity. It's the government's duty.
attributes.additional_details:
1/ The amount spent on Trident is obscene.
2/ The shameful shortfall required to barely fund care and support currently is being topped up by charities. Without it they would be even worse off. 
3/ It's been going on for too long.
4/ The Government has all the stats. What they need is the guts and moral stamina to take care of our fallen. Fully.
5/ The Poppy has become a symbol of successive Government's failure to care for our damaged service people and their families.
6/ It's our moral duty.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all non-vehicular road users to wear hi-viz
attributes.background: In daylight or dusk, hi-viz is highly visible to road users.  To reduce the number of accidents on the road, we call for the Government to make it a legal requirement for all road users to wear hi-viz clothing including, but not limited to, motorcyclists, cyclists, runners, walkers and horse-riders.

attributes.action: Privatise the Bank of England
attributes.background: The Bank of England was formed in 1694 and nationalised in 1946.  We have reduced the National Debt by privatising Steel, Coal, Utilities, BT and Railways.  Restored to its historical role BoE would be a better controller of the Banks and a check to the Treasury.
attributes.additional_details: Gordon Brown set in place in 1997 a well planned stealth move to undermine democracy and accountability of monetary policy. He also unhooked the Bank Rate from Government borrowing. We now have a situation where there is no political control of our Bank Rate which at 0.5% is detrimental to savers, unfair to those on fixed incomes and those seeking annuities for pensions but very favorable to the Bankers who caused the 2008 crash.

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to less than 12.5% give companies a reason to stay in UK
attributes.background: Post Brexit vote we need immediate action from the government as many companies will already be planning to leave the UK. Time is of the essence and we need to halt a mass exodus of  businesses and secure jobs for Britain. In-party politics should take second place to measures such as this.

attributes.action: A tenant should not be evicted, after expiry of the tenancy without any reason.
attributes.background: A tenant usually sign tenancy agreement for 12 months, but after the expiry of the tenancy agreement, landlord issues him 2 month's Section 21 Notice and evict him by county court order. This destroys the family life of the tenant. He needs to struggle again to establish a normal family life.

attributes.action: Make sanitary bins in male toilets compulsory for the transgender community.
attributes.background: I would like male toilets to have sanitation bins as the transgender community will be able to feel more comfortable and not have to use the female toilets if they are menstruating. This will promote self esteem among the transgender community.
attributes.additional_details: As gender neutral toilets are gradually coming into place, I believe it is very appropriate that the transgender community is made to feel as comfortable as they can be. The cost of the sanitation bins are very little and extremely convenient. The bins will be used if the trans* man is menstruating. He will then be able to use the male bathroom and feel comfortable doing so.

attributes.action: A highly experienced business figure should lead UK exit negotiations with EU
attributes.background: Given the extreme importance of negotiating the best possible exit for the UK from the EU, the government should employ the services of a highly experienced, independent business figure to lead & manage the negotiations. We need the best person for the job who is unlikely to be a politician.

attributes.action: Brexit negotiations to promote a strong & collaborative relationship with the EU
attributes.background: Sixteen million people voted to Remain. The views of these people and the weight of their opinion must be reflected in Brexit negotiations. The negotiation team must focus on forging a strong, collaborative and balanced working relationship with the EU, and be made up accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
I was vehemently for Remain, and now I am determined that Brexit is made to mean healthy collaboration with the EU on new terms (and terms that the Northern Ireland and Scotland can support as part of the UK) rather than a soapbox for nationalistic rhetoric!

Britain may have voted out, but it clearly and emphatically does not want away. Most importantly, Brexit does not (and will not) mean embracing the Farage and Le Pen view of the world!

It is hope the EU will help us make this happen.

attributes.action: RAISE Tariffs on IMPORTED steel to keep British Steel ALIVE.
attributes.background: Our manufacturing sector has been decimated over decades of neglect and a sense of simply not caring. A strong manufacturing sector constitutes a resilient, strong, diverse and booming economy. WE NEED MORE THAN JUST SERVICES. We can begin by raising tariffs on imported, cheap steel.
attributes.additional_details: Our Steel Industry has been decimated over the years by cheap Chinese and other low labour cost nation imports. LEVY IT. This will promote projects within the UK to use British Steel thus reviving the industry, producing jobs and a renewed sense of pride within ourselves. Moreover, to support and kick start this I want capital, state projects to ONLY use British Steel. Beginning with HS2 and other ongoing projects. I believe this will boost economic output and GDP and benefit us all immensely.

attributes.action: Allow Tunbridge Wells a referendum to separate from the UK alongside Scotland.
attributes.background:
Tunbridge Wells voted in favour of remaining as part of the EU against the trend of the rest of the country.

Please allow Tunbridge Wells an independence referendum (along the lines of the inevitable Scottish Referendum for independence) so that it can renegotiate itself back into the EU.

attributes.action: Poll Leave the EU Voters their reasons and present this to the EU before Brexit.
attributes.background: Anti-EU sentiment is not exclusive to the UK. With a Brexit, it is clear the EU will need to implement reforms to prevent other Nations from following suit. Why wait for the UK to leave the EU before reforming? Poll those who voted Leave for their reasons (it is currently not clear). Present these.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU should use this poll result of Leave voters to present reforms. The UK can then vote again that with these reforms, do we still want to leave the EU? 

Some may argue that David Cameron already asked for reforms. However, it is clear few really actually believed the UK would vote to leave. Now that it is clear, ask why the people voted this way and the EU should present new reforms. 

EU reforms will need to come. The EU has the chance now to do so before a Brexit actually happens.
